Dates === Differently from other major Roman structures circuses frequently evolved over long periods of time from a simple track in a field , through generations of wooden seating structures ( frequently destroyed by fire or rot ) , before they finally began to be converted to stone . Although circuses such as the Circus Maximus ( Italy ) may have existed in some form from as early as around 500BC , circuses were mainly constructed during the 400 years between 200BC and 200AD.

The carceres were designed for the races to
be run round the spina in an anticlockwise direction . The form of the carceres appears to have been standardised throughout the Roman world .
